regular.quote: I think AI Safety Atlas is awesome! I highly encourage further donations.
regular.name: Ryan Kidd

regular.quote: This is the kind of resource I would have loved to have when first learning about AI safety.
regular.name: Martin Kunev

regular.quote: The systematic approach makes it remarkably easier to integrate into existing curricula.
regular.name: Course Organizer

regular.quote: This work is fundamentally useful for everyone involved in, or curious about, the development of safe Artificial Intelligences. It's a precious endeavor that every AI enthusiast should support.
regular.name: Victor Daudonnet

regular.quote: Atlas is great. I think there should be additional courses with a different style then the BlueDot courses that are a bit lengthy etc. I think Atlas could produce that!
regular.name: Evander Hammer

regular.quote: This was my first time reading the AI Safety Atlas and wow!!! It has so many insightful information and citations that I am looking forward to diving deeper into. I am super fascinated by this text and I feel I have learned so much from it already.
regular.name: Student

regular.quote: I like the amount of real-life examples incorporated into the writing when talking about a certain concept, and the citations following those examples so we can go more in depth into specific examples if we like.
regular.name: Student

regular.quote: I haven't spent much time reading the Atlas, but I've attended 3 of Markov's presentations (with Q&As). He is obviously a gifted and passionate teacher, and he has shown himself to be deeply familiar with most ideas and arguments in AI Safety.
regular.name: Gustavo Lacerda

regular.quote: I co-lead the Turing Seminar while the Atlas was still being developped at ENS Paris. It offers a comprehensive survey of different fields of AIS and is clearly written and coherent. The facilitation guide did most of the heavy-lifting for me, by offering intriguing and entertaining questions to the class.
regular.name: Camille Berger

regular.quote: I read part of the Atlas (Evaluation Chapter). As an AI safety research engineer, I find it a pretty good in-depth introduction. It covers a lot in a very clear way.
regular.name: Maxime Riche

regular.quote: A strong theory of change, well executed in practice. Very good material at the end. They have my support!
regular.name: Thibaud Veron

regular.quote: That's one of the best AI safety fundamentals material, available for free. Very accessible, comprehensive and well-written.
regular.name: Leo Karoubi

regular.quote: This project is a great overview of up-to-date fundamentals in AI safety. It was the right choice for our technical intro course at UBC AI Safety in Vancouver, Canada.
regular.name: Josh Thorsteinson

regular.quote: The AI Safety Atlas is excellent teaching material. I'd know since I read it multiple times and I often go back to it for reference.
regular.name: Amaury Lorin
